alert.note: Alert for Christian; Douglas; Ozark; Stone; Taney; Webster; Wright (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued April 13 at 11:59AM CDT until April 13 at 2:30PM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 230 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON FOR EASTERN CHRISTIAN, WESTERN DOUGLAS, NORTHWESTERN OZARK, SOUTHERN STONE, TANEY, SOUTHERN WEBSTER AND SOUTHWESTERN WRIGHT COUNTIES... At 1159 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area as another round of heavy rainfall moves northward from northern Arkansas. Flash flooding is already ongoing near Ava along Hunter and Cowskin Creeks. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Branson, Marshfield, Ava, Kimberling City, Forsyth, Hollister, Rogersville and Silver Dollar City. This includes the following low water crossings... Little Beaver Creek at Old Cheese Plant Road, Bull Creek at Center Road, James River at Bell Ford Road, Beaver Creek at County Road 524 and Little Beaver Creek at County Road 447. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles.
